newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy Aug CPI seen at 3.3/3.4 pct yr/yr -analysts.
newsitem.headline: Italy Aug CPI seen at 3.3/3.4 pct yr/yr -analysts.

text.p: Italian consumer prices are estimated to be growing at 3.3/3.4 percent year on year in August and at 0.0/0.1 percent month on month, according to analysts' estimates based on preliminary data on Wednesday.
This compares with forecasts for 3.4 percent and 0.1-0.2 percent respectively.
In July, Italian CPI grew 3.6 percent year on year but fell 0.2 percent on a month on month basis.
The economists' forecasts were based on data released on Wednesday by six Italian cities, Milan, Turin, Genoa, Trieste, Venice and Palermo.
Florence, Bologna, Naples and Perugia release their preliminary data for August on Thursday and final August CPI will be published by national statistics institute ISTAT on September 5.
The 10 sample cities have a combined weighting of 69.67 percent on the national index.
